details:
Several vulnerabilities have been found in php5, a server-side,
HTML-embedded scripting language.


* [CVE-2019-9637](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-9637)
rename() across the device may allow unwanted access during
 processing.
* [CVE-2019-9638](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-9638)
[CVE-2019-9639](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-9639)
Uninitialized read in exif\_process\_IFD\_in\_MAKERNOTE.
* [CVE-2019-9640](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-9640)
Invalid Read on exif\_process\_SOFn.
* [CVE-2019-9641](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-9641)
Uninitialized read in exif\_process\_IFD\_in\_TIFF.
* [CVE-2019-9022](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-9022)
An issue during parsing of DNS responses allows a hostile DNS server
 to misuse memcpy, which leads to a read operation past an allocated
 buffer.


For Debian 8 Jessie, these problems have been fixed in version
5.6.40+dfsg-0+deb8u2.


We recommend that you upgrade your php5 packages.


Further information about Debian LTS security advisories, how to apply
these updates to your system and frequently asked questions can be
found at: <https://wiki.debian.org/LTS>
